entry.title: bkc39/shellgpt.el
entry.summary:
A lightweight ChatGPT client for Emacs based on shell-gpt

shellgpt.el

A ChatGPT client for Emacs based on shell-gpt.

Installation

First you need to install shell-gpt.

$ pip install shell-gpt

use-package

Clone the repository

$ git clone git@github.com:bkc39/shellgpt.el.git <path-to-shellgpt.el>

Then in your init file add:

(use-package shellgpt
  :load-path "<path-to-shellgpt.el>"
  :bind ("C-c q" . shellgpt:quick-ask))

straight.el

In your Emacs init file put in the following incantantion:

(use-package shellgpt
  :straight (:host github
             :repo "bkc39/shellgpt.el"
             :files ("dist" "*.el"))
  :bind ("C-c q" . shellgpt:quick-ask))

Usage

You need to set the environment variable OPENAI_API_KEY

$ echo 'export OPENAI_API_KEY=<YOUR-API-KEY>' >> ~/.zshrc # or your shell init file

Alternatively, if if OPENAI_API_KEY is not defined then it will search for shellgpt:openai-config-file, which should contain your api key as its contents. The default is ~/.openai but you can customize this in your init:

(use-package shellgpt
  ...
  :custom
  (shellgpt:openai-config-file PATH))

Send a query with "M-x shellgpt:quick-ask", or if you use the bindings in the configs above, "C-c q".
